reviewText: Warfare is a mediocre combat game that's hopelessly incorrect politically and otherwise. The plot opens with a series of terrorist attacks against Saudi oil wells (in reality, saudi oil ensures the wealth of S.A. and there are links between the oil tycoons and terrorist groups, so they're cutting themselves off from their money supply) which are funded by the Taliban. The Americans intervene, stationing troops in Saudi Arabia, while a popular revolt (including the Saudi Generals) tries to take over. The King (arrogant, ignorant, dodgy accent) and his advisors (simpering, flattering, also dodgy accent) flee while the American forces rush in to save the day.

reviewText:
Saudi Arabia, one of the world's leading oil suppliers and a key U.S. ally, has been taken over by a highly organized group of radical terrorists. The government is in a state of collapse and turmoil and you have been chosen to lead the United States' armed forces to restore control.

Search and destroy using the latest military hardware from the Abrams tank to the Apache helicopter in realistic settings ranging from the open desert to close-quarters infantry combat. Wear down enemy morale by capturing vehicles, weapons and buildings. You'll need elite forces to destroy the world's best-armed fanatics, bent on world-wide economic collapse. The soldiers who survive will gain experience and move with you from mission to mission.

Failure is not an option — This is Warfare.

voteText: No ratings yet

reviewText:
Underrated little gem of a RTS/ Tactics Game.

Like Military Real Time Tactical but sick of fighting WWII for the 50th time? Good modern warfare RTTs like World in Conflict/ Wargame only happen every few years so if you like those games check this out.

A good compromise between realism and fun. Unit promotion system and basic economy system to reward keeping units alive for multiple mission. Pre / Post mission unit management similar to a very simplified Theatre of War interface but without the frusturating soldier by soldier search through a platoon for a good gunner or driver.

Graphics on par with Command and Conquer Generals, which was good for the time. A lot more unit and ammo options for individual units but that is to be expected in a good Tatical Game. Unit salvage a good element that adds to the gameplay. Soundtrack good for the budget as well.

I have heard Nvidia graphics users have had problems but this game is old enough to run fine on the CPU graphics amd and intel have.

Real shame there is no demo for this game as most would be understandably reluctant to retail purchase a game from an unknown franchsise and developer that was under the radar from the day it was released. I might humbly suggest a certain bundle website.
voteText: 41 of 48 people (85%) found this review helpful

reviewText: This game is a gem under mud.\nAt first glance I thought it's just low class game but I wrong about it. I have to admit that this game is fun. It's like Red Alert but require more strategies and tactics. Do not underestimate low price game.
voteText: 22 of 28 people (79%) found this review helpful 2 people found this review funny

reviewText:
One of the best RTS Strategy games set in modern times.
The game can be quite hard on the Normal difficulty, but only when you make mistakes. Rush in all your forces into an enemy encampment for example! Then you will find it hard to complete certain missions. Though taking it easy, planning your plan of attack.
Also like others have said you can spend hours on it and it is true so take your time and enjoy it.

This is a must have game for RTS fans and I do recommend it.

reviewText:
Feels like Blitzkrieg with a modern warfare facelift... interface is clunky, limited zoom levels, no keyboard scrolling (mouse edge only), units don't move as you expect (all on foot units stop moving with anything in range, can't capture enemy BMP even though the text suggested that you could, primary Bradley ran out of fuel before even reaching objective... and that's just the FIRST battle which makes no sense.

UPDATE: turns out you have to use a vehicle crew to capture another vehicle. Dumped the Bradley for the BMP1 then proceed to clear the route and managed to finish the first mission despite a tank killed almost everybody except that one BMP. This wasn't explained close to well enough in the manual.

There's a gem somewhere hidden under there, but it's kinda hard to find. I guess if you got tired of the typical RTS you can give this one a try, but I find Wargame series to be better.
